version_a.description: Fixed version with explicit reentrancy guards in all critical functions

ground_truth.root_cause: Vyper compiler versions 0.2.15-0.3.0 had a bug in the @nonreentrant decorator implementation. When multiple functions used the decorator, the compiler generated incorrect bytecode that checked the wrong storage slot, making protection ineffective.
ground_truth.attack_vector: Attacker takes flash loan, calls add_liquidity(), during ETH transfer triggers receive() callback, recursively calls add_liquidity() again, pool mints LP tokens twice for overlapping deposits, attacker extracts more assets than deposited.

differential_details.changes_description_a: Added explicit reentrancy guard in add_liquidity, remove_liquidity, and exchange functions (lines 58, 90, 137). Set status before critical operations and reset after, preventing reentrancy attacks.
differential_details.changes_description_b: Removed explicit reentrancy guard from add_liquidity, remove_liquidity, and exchange functions (lines 58, 90, 137), allowing recursive calls and enabling reentrancy attacks.
differential_details.why_this_matters: The minimal fix (explicit reentrancy guards) prevents recursive calls during ETH transfers, blocking the attack vector that caused $70M in losses across multiple Curve pools.
